data.fullContent: In writing the script, Schrader was inspired by the diaries of Arthur Bremer (who shot presidential candidate George Wallace in 1972) and Fyodor Dostoyevsky's Notes from Underground. The writer also used himself as inspiration; prior to writing the screenplay, Schrader was in a lonely and alienated position, much like Bickle is. Following a divorce and a breakup with a live-in girlfriend, he spent a few weeks living in his car. He wrote the script in under a month while staying in his former girlfriend's apartment while she was away.
data.answer: 在写剧本时，施雷德的灵感来自于阿瑟·布雷默(1972年，他枪杀了总统候选人乔治·华莱士)的日记和费多尔·陀思妥耶夫斯基的《地下笔记》。这位作家也把自己作为灵感来源;在写剧本之前，Schrader和Bickle一样，处于一种孤独和疏离的状态。在与一位同居女友离婚并分手后，他有几周时间住在自己的车里。他在不到一个月的时间里写好了剧本，而他的前女友不在时，他就住在她的公寓里。
